intro: Ageratina lobulifera, commonly known as the lobed ageratum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display. Ageratina lobulifera prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for garden landscapes in warm climates.
